page.title: 09Rogart - Trade (Mart)
page.content: Every April, August, September and October sales are held by Reith and Anderson, Dingwall, at Rogart Auction Market. Most local families make sale day a day out; so around 300 people attend. At least 7,000 lambs, 3,000 sheep, 30 rams and 500 head of cattle are sold annually. In August, buyers come from Aberdeenshire and the Borders to buy Rogart lambs for fattening. The remaining sales are attended by local people, who buy to increase or improve their stock. The weather can affect the quality of the lambs. A hard winter can cause animals to lose a lot of weight. A good spring can mean lambs are in excellent condition. If the seller gets a fair price, he will sell. If he gets a poor price, he may be forced to take them home again.
